message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur's photo. Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur brings you IBM technology challenge! This challenge is divided into 3 phases :- Online Quiz Challenge - There are 30 MCQs to be solved in 60 minutes. Hack Camp - Hack Camp will be set-up, where mentors from IBM will impart knowledge on IBM technologies and train students for the next stage. Hackathon - This is the final stage where students will be developing applications based on IBM technologies. now at www.venturesity Camp Venue : 27th August | Vikramshila | 10 AM

Join Career Launcher's Smart CAT Prep course(MRP.7899/-) at Rs.999/- only. Offer only for students studying in IITKGP not for alumnus. Registration today (20th Aug'16) at VEGIES between 1 - 8 pm. Carry 1 photo & ID card. WhatsApp-9051119190 for more details.
Nimb is a ring with a panic button that allows you to send an emergency alert to preset contacts from the mobile app with just the touch of a thumb.

For the past few days, we have been seeing a growing trend of resentment amongst the students sitting for placements and internships regarding the newly introduced CV module for the auto-generation of Resumes by CDC. As a responsible media body, representing the common voice of student community, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, conducted a survey regarding this new CV module and to the no amazement, we got responses from about 400 of the students who will be sitting in the upcoming placements. Here, we present to you the general issues faced by students with detailed infographics on the basis of collected data. Some specific problems addressed by the students have also been put forward in the article. Go on the below link for detailed analysis.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/cv.php

message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared M N Faruqui Innovations Centre's photo. Aakruti is a 3D Designing contest for Engineering and Design students.This contest is a unique opportunity for the students to demonstrate their creative abilities and bring their imagination to life. The highlights of this year's competition are: >> Employment opportunity for top two teams* at 3DPLM. >> Free license of SOLIDWORKS full version to use at home for participating in contest >> Prizes worth ₹ 2 Lakhs. >> Trophy for college submitting maximum qualified entries. >> Opportunity to create a product which can help in building up and grow the nation. Find more at http://www.3dpl team should be of final year students)

भाई की कलाई पर राखी का रेशमी बंधन प्रतिबिम्ब है भाई बहन के बीच के स्नेह और भरोसे का। आज हमारी एक बहन साक्षी मलिक ने रियो ओलंपिक में कांस्य पदक जीतकर जो इतिहास रचा  है, हमारी उम्मीद को सत्यता तक पहुँचाया है, उससे हम सब भारतवासियों का सर गर्व से ऊँचा हो गया है तो आइये आज हम सब  एकजुट होकर यह  स्नेह का धागा उनके नाम करते हैं  |
आवाज़ परिवार की ओर से सभी को रक्षाबंधन की हार्दिक शुभकामनाएं !!
#Rakhi_4_Sakshi

आई.आई.टी खड़गपुर के सभी विद्यार्थियों एवं शिक्षकगणों को 66वें स्थापना दिवस की ढेरों बधाईयाँ | 65 वर्ष पूर्व आज ही के दिन इस महान संस्थान का शिलान्यास मौलाना अबुल कलाम आज़ाद के हाथों हुआ था और आज ही के दिन उस उम्मीद का भी शिलान्यास हुआ था जो भारत को विज्ञान और तकनीक के माध्यम से दोबारा विश्व गुरु बना सकता है | जवाहरलाल नेहरू की उम्मीदों का हाथ थामे, आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर, तीव्र इच्छा-शक्ति के साथ भारत निर्माण के दिशा में उठाया गया पहला कदम था | इसके बाद कई और आई.आई.टी. बनाये गए अर्थात इस दिन को सभी आई.आई.टियों का प्रातिबिंबीक स्थापना दिवस भी माना जा सकता है | 
आवाज़, आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर इस शुभ अवसर पर उन सभी लोगों को अभिवादन करता है जिन्होंने औपचारिक अथवा अनौपचारिक तौर पर आई.आई.टी. केजीपी के निर्माण में योगदान दिया तथा आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर के सुगम भविष्य की कामना करता है |
Be there at the Netaji Auditorium at 6pm today as Eastern Technology Music Society takes you on a musical journey!!

Career Development Centre introduced a new system of CV generation for the Internships and Placements 2016-17 this year. Right from the inception, students have been facing many problems with this system and CDC has taken many timely inputs from the students and has made an ample number of changes in the system till date, but it is not up to the mark and the students are still struggling with this method. It has now reached the level of higher complexity. We have decided to take up this issue and we request the Placement Junta to participate in this survey and help us to raise this important issue as the deadline of registration is approaching fast (22nd Aug) . We'll be sending the analysis  of this survey to the concerned authorities for the necessary actions.
http://tinyurl.com/hdjalm5

Come, and play each point like your life depends on it .

The students of IIT Kharagpur have taken an initiative to celebrate Independence Day with the deprived children of village Soladhar, around 1.5 km from Prem Bazaar gate. Students collected fund themselves and visited villages to celebrate Independence Day with those children. 
This independence day, Students of IIT Kharagpur organized a Prabhat Pheri and encouraged villagers to join them. They unfurled flag, sung patriotic songs, cheered them for their performance and gave speeches to motivate to learn and be health conscious. Sweets, Fruits, Biscuits, Notebooks and pens were also distributed afterwards.
This social work has been undertaken by Hemant Singh,  Sushant Suman,  Ajay Kumar Singh, Deepak Verma, Amit Kumar Das, Tapasya Singh, Vishal Singh, Ashwinikant Tiwari, Yashwant Singh, Jagannath and some other students.
Awaaz,IIT Kharagpur wishes such attempts be taken on a regular basis for the benefits of the society.

Today, at 6:30 PM, the greatest secrets of the universe would be revealed, including what The Scholars' Avenue is all about. Moreover, we'll flabbergast you with some of our amazing analyses on KGP. If you find writing, hanging out with cool and intelligent people, journalism and trips to the island of Greenland interesting, we'll see you there!

The institute has passed a new rule restricting bicycles to the newly constructed lanes during class hours. But it has come to the notice of TSA that the cramped lanes often lead to accidents while the roads tend to remain empty for most of the time. Many students also expressed the feeling that the rule curbs their freedom at KGP.

What do KGPians think about this rule and what has been your experience so far?

Tomorrow, at 6:30 PM, the greatest secrets of the universe would be revealed, including what The Scholars' Avenue is all about. Moreover, we'll flabbergast you with some of our amazing analyses on KGP. If you find writing, hanging out with cool and intelligent people, journalism and trips to the island of Greenland interesting, we'll see you there!

Independence Day Schedule

Venue : Bidhan Chowk

08:56 am - Arrival of the Director
08:58 am - General Salute by IIT Security & NCC Cadets.
09:00 am - Unfurling of National Flag by Director followed by National Anthem.
09:03 am - Director Inspects the Guard of Honour
09:07 am - Oath Taking Ceremony
09:10 am - Address by the Director
There are other programs as well. You can check it on this poster.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone Happy Independence Day.

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's post. We welcome Prof B N Singh as the new Dean of HR, IIT Kharagpur. He will look after all matters related to employees other than Faculty. We also welcome Prof Pallab Dasgupta as Dean Sponsored Research & Industrial Consultancy (SRIC) and Prof Suman Chakraborty as the new Associate Dean of SRIC. All of them have take up their roles today. We deeply acknowledge the contributions of Prof Sunando Dasgupta, the outgoing Dean SRIC.

Congratulations to Team KART-Formula SAE team of IIT-Kharagpur on the successful unveiling of their latest car - the K3. We hope all their great efforts and pains in making the car are repaid in renewed heaps of prestige - both to the team and our institute at an international level. 

We had a chance to talk to the heads of the team, who were more than happy to explain about their car. You can read it here:
http://www.scholarsavenue.org/campus-2/the-russian-calling-for-teamkart/

The teaser of the unveiling of the car and the making of the car have  been covered extensively by our own Technology Filmmaking & Photography Society, IIT Kharagpur - TFPS . The links to the videos are given below:

Teaser : https://youtu.be/Te-liFOwac0

Behind the Scenes : https://youtu.be/y1-rj-D_hgE

The Scholars' Avenue wishes the team all the very best for their future ventures.

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo. Congratulations to Prof Manoj Tiwari from Depatment of ISE, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur for being awarded “The Most Influential Researcher” in the area of Operations Management in India on the occasion of the 3rd International Conference on Green Supply Chain Management, which was organized at Loughborough University, London from 10th -13th July 2016. Prof. Tiwari received this award from Prof. Sir Mike Gregory. Prof. Sir Mike Gregory is one of the most influential academics in the UK and the Co-Founder and Head of the Institute of Manufacturing and Management Division at Cambridge University, UK. The award was given to Prof. Tiwari for his pioneering contribution to the field of Operations and Supply Chain Management and was based on his credentials, citations and research by leading international researchers, who suggested that Prof. Tiwari is the most influential researcher in India in this field of research in their findings

story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo.
message: The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo. IIT Kharagpur announces Distinguished Alumnus Awards 2016 IIT Kharagpur to award 7 of its Distinguished Alumni for significant contributions to the professional world and society Kharagpur, July 12, 2016: Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur will confer the Distinguished Alumnus Award on the occasion of the 62nd Convocation of the Institute being organized on July 30 and 31, 2016. Seven eminent alumni have been selected for the award for their exceptional professional achievements in the industry, in the academia or as entrepreneur. The awardees, in alphabetical order, are - Dr. Anurag Acharya (IIT KGP B.Tech./Computer Science and Engineering/1987), Distinguished Engineer at Google USA. Dr. Acharya is key founder of Google Scholar which since its inception has become an indispensable service for the global academic and research community. Shri Ajit Jain (IIT KGP B.Tech./Mechanical Engineering/1972), President of Reinsurance Division, Berkshire Hathaway Insurance Group, USA. Shri Jain is a visionary in the global investment sector, having led Berkshire Hathaway to great heights. He is a well-known philanthropist as well funding the Jain Foundation with the mission is to cure muscular dystrophies. Dr. Asoke Deysarkar (IIT KGP B.Tech./Chemical Engineering/1971), CEO & Chairman, PfP Industries, USA. Dr. Deysarkar has blended his research with entrepreneurship in Chemical Engineering forming a billion dollar conglomerate of companies. The Deysarkar Family has helped establish the Trans-disciplinary Program in Petroleum Engineering at IIT KGP. Dr. Deysarkar is also known for his philanthropy activities. Prof. Gautam Biswas (IIT KGP Ph.D/Mechanical Engineering / 1985), Director, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati. Prof. Biswas has an illustrious academic career of 25 years having taught at IIT Kharagpur, IIT Kanpur and in various international universities and known for his leadership at IIT Kanpur, Central Mechanical Engineering Research Institute, Durgapur and IIT Guwahati. His fundamental research on heat transfer phenomena is well recognised in the international academic community. He was the Founder Director of Academy of Scientific and Innovative Research (AcSIR), New Delhi. Prof. Indranil Manna (IIT KGP Ph.D/Metallurgical and Materials Engineering/ 1990), Director, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur. He has been an exceptional academician and researcher having a long-standing association with IIT Kharagpur as faculty and thereafter leading the Central Glass and Ceramic Research Institute, Kolkata and IIT Kanpur. His significant contributions in advanced material science and engineering have been well recognised by national and international bodies. Prof. Supriyo Bandopadhyay (IIT KGP B.Tech./Electronics and Electrical Communications Engineering/1980), Commonwealth Professor, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Virginia Commonwealth University, USA. Recently he was named Virginia's Outstanding Scientist and is known globally for his interdisciplinary research. He directs the Quantum Device Laboratory in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering which has been frequently featured in national and international media for exemplary research in nanotechnology. Venkatesan Thirumalai (B.Sc./Physics /1969), Director, NUSNNI-NanoCore, National University of Singapore. He is known for his pioneering research in laser technology. Prof. Venkatesan was Founder of the PhD/MBA program in NUS and the Surface Center at Rutgers University. The Distinguished Alumnus Award is one of the highest recognitions given of accomplishment and contribution of an alumnus/alumna from the Institute. The awardees will be given a gold medal and a certificate.

story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post. SRISTI celebrates the creativity and innovation of young technological students by recognising their outstanding projects with Gandhian Young Technological Innovation (GYTI) Awards. These awards are given every year during the Festival of Innovation (FOIN) at Rashtrapati Bhawan in the month of March. Next year, these awards are due tentatively on March 5, 2017 at FOIN. It is hoped that such recognition will enthuse young innovators to pursue even more outstanding research addressing unmet social needs and set up entrepreneurial ventures in consonance with Start-Up movement gaining strength currently in India. Any student project that has been completed during 2014-15 to 2016-17 is eligible for consideration of awards.The students need to submit the projects at following URL: www.gyti.techpe Financial support is also given to some of the awardees as per numerous windows of opportunity: Last date for submission of entries is November 30, 2016 You can email your queries to gyti.techpedia@ ,or call at 9099258492.

story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos — with Vedasheersh Boorla and Somesh Kumar.
message:
Interactive session with Prof. John Mather witnessed an overwhelming response from students and faculty members alike.

We are sincerely thankful to Prof. Somesh Kumar to make the event successful.

A senior astrophysicist at NASA, Prof. Mather is the recipient of 2006 Nobel prize in Physics. He is a senior project scientist at JSWT, which will be successor to Hubble Space Telescope. He was part of the COBE satellite, which confirmed the Big Bang theory. He was listed twice by TIME magazine; among 100 most influential people in the world in 2007 and then again in 2012 among 25 most influential people in space.

Strengthen the foundation of your thoughts through his precious words.

Date: 29th February (Monday), 6:30 PM
Venue: CET Studio 1, First Floor, Takshashila

A PAN IIT interactive session with Prof. Herald Haas has been arranged on 14th February at 6:30PM. Prof. Haas holds the Chair of Mobile Communications at the University of Edinburgh. He is acclaimed to be the inventor of Light Fidelity (Li-Fi) which was listed among the 50 best inventions in TIME Magazine 2011.

Link for webcast is http://nknvcreplay.nic.in/replay/webcastShow.html?key=vUUIZ1dDHHitrBr

Link will be live from Sunday (14th Feb.) 6:30 PM onward. Venue for online interaction is NKN Virtual Classroom, JCB Lab Complex.

Note: The event will consist of a keynote speech from 6:30 PM - 8:00 PM. Q&A session will be from 8:15 PM.

IIT Kharagpur has won the 4th Inter IIT Tech General Championship winning the General Championship for a continuous 2nd time in a row.

Results of all Events:

1st. IIT Kharagpur
2nd. IIT Mandi
3rd. IIT Madras

This challenge is divided into 3 phases :- Online Quiz Challenge - There are 30 MCQs to be solved in 60 minutes. Hack Camp - Hack Camp will be set-up, where mentors from IBM will impart knowledge on IBM technologies and train students for the next stage. Hackathon - This is the final stage where students will be developing applications based on IBM technologies. now at www.venturesity Camp Venue : 27th August | Vikramshila | 10 AM

105 CL student from IIT-KGP get 700+ IIM calls in CAT'15. Now it's your turn. 
Join Career Launcher's Smart CAT Prep course(MRP.7899/-) at Rs.999/- only. Offer only for students studying in IITKGP not for alumnus. Registration today (20th Aug'16) at VEGIES between 1 - 8 pm. Carry 1 photo & ID card. WhatsApp-9051119190 for more details.
Nimb is a ring with a panic button that allows you to send an emergency alert to preset contacts from the mobile app with just the touch of a thumb.

For the past few days, we have been seeing a growing trend of resentment amongst the students sitting for placements and internships regarding the newly introduced CV module for the auto-generation of Resumes by CDC. As a responsible media body, representing the common voice of student community, Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur, conducted a survey regarding this new CV module and to the no amazement, we got responses from about 400 of the students who will be sitting in the upcoming placements. Here, we present to you the general issues faced by students with detailed infographics on the basis of collected data. Some specific problems addressed by the students have also been put forward in the article. Go on the below link for detailed analysis.
http://awaaziitkgp.org/cv.php

Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared M N Faruqui Innovations Centre's photo. Aakruti is a 3D Designing contest for Engineering and Design students.This contest is a unique opportunity for the students to demonstrate their creative abilities and bring their imagination to life. The highlights of this year's competition are: >> Employment opportunity for top two teams* at 3DPLM. >> Free license of SOLIDWORKS full version to use at home for participating in contest >> Prizes worth ₹ 2 Lakhs. >> Trophy for college submitting maximum qualified entries. >> Opportunity to create a product which can help in building up and grow the nation. Find more at http://www.3dpl team should be of final year students)

message:
भाई की कलाई पर राखी का रेशमी बंधन प्रतिबिम्ब है भाई बहन के बीच के स्नेह और भरोसे का। आज हमारी एक बहन साक्षी मलिक ने रियो ओलंपिक में कांस्य पदक जीतकर जो इतिहास रचा  है, हमारी उम्मीद को सत्यता तक पहुँचाया है, उससे हम सब भारतवासियों का सर गर्व से ऊँचा हो गया है तो आइये आज हम सब  एकजुट होकर यह  स्नेह का धागा उनके नाम करते हैं  |
आवाज़ परिवार की ओर से सभी को रक्षाबंधन की हार्दिक शुभकामनाएं !!
#Rakhi_4_Sakshi

Get ready to be swept off your feet as BreakFree : Technology Dance Society IIT Kharagpur prepares to captivate you!! 
Be there at the Netaji Auditorium at 7.45pm today for their Foundation Day production!!

आई.आई.टी खड़गपुर के सभी विद्यार्थियों एवं शिक्षकगणों को 66वें स्थापना दिवस की ढेरों बधाईयाँ | 65 वर्ष पूर्व आज ही के दिन इस महान संस्थान का शिलान्यास मौलाना अबुल कलाम आज़ाद के हाथों हुआ था और आज ही के दिन उस उम्मीद का भी शिलान्यास हुआ था जो भारत को विज्ञान और तकनीक के माध्यम से दोबारा विश्व गुरु बना सकता है | जवाहरलाल नेहरू की उम्मीदों का हाथ थामे, आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर, तीव्र इच्छा-शक्ति के साथ भारत निर्माण के दिशा में उठाया गया पहला कदम था | इसके बाद कई और आई.आई.टी. बनाये गए अर्थात इस दिन को सभी आई.आई.टियों का प्रातिबिंबीक स्थापना दिवस भी माना जा सकता है | 
आवाज़, आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर इस शुभ अवसर पर उन सभी लोगों को अभिवादन करता है जिन्होंने औपचारिक अथवा अनौपचारिक तौर पर आई.आई.टी. केजीपी के निर्माण में योगदान दिया तथा आई.आई.टी. खड़गपुर के सुगम भविष्य की कामना करता है |
Be there at the Netaji Auditorium at 6pm today as Eastern Technology Music Society takes you on a musical journey!!

Career Development Centre introduced a new system of CV generation for the Internships and Placements 2016-17 this year. Right from the inception, students have been facing many problems with this system and CDC has taken many timely inputs from the students and has made an ample number of changes in the system till date, but it is not up to the mark and the students are still struggling with this method. It has now reached the level of higher complexity. We have decided to take up this issue and we request the Placement Junta to participate in this survey and help us to raise this important issue as the deadline of registration is approaching fast (22nd Aug) . We'll be sending the analysis  of this survey to the concerned authorities for the necessary actions.
http://tinyurl.com/hdjalm5

Sports do not build your character ,they reveal it .
Life is like tennis,No matter how many times you try,if you keep on doing the same mistakes and you don't practice to get it right ,You will never get better.
Come, and play each point like your life depends on it .
LAWN TENNIS OPEN IIT TOURNAMENT

Venue : TSG Tennis Court.
Contact your hall G SEC. Sports for registration.
Reporting on 20th August, 9am sharp at TSG Tennis Court.

PARUSH PATEL
Secretary Tennis
9932579877

The students of IIT Kharagpur have taken an initiative to celebrate Independence Day with the deprived children of village Soladhar, around 1.5 km from Prem Bazaar gate. Students collected fund themselves and visited villages to celebrate Independence Day with those children. 
This independence day, Students of IIT Kharagpur organized a Prabhat Pheri and encouraged villagers to join them. They unfurled flag, sung patriotic songs, cheered them for their performance and gave speeches to motivate to learn and be health conscious. Sweets, Fruits, Biscuits, Notebooks and pens were also distributed afterwards.
This social work has been undertaken by Hemant Singh,  Sushant Suman,  Ajay Kumar Singh, Deepak Verma, Amit Kumar Das, Tapasya Singh, Vishal Singh, Ashwinikant Tiwari, Yashwant Singh, Jagannath and some other students.
Awaaz,IIT Kharagpur wishes such attempts be taken on a regular basis for the benefits of the society.

Today, at 6:30 PM, the greatest secrets of the universe would be revealed, including what The Scholars' Avenue is all about. Moreover, we'll flabbergast you with some of our amazing analyses on KGP. If you find writing, hanging out with cool and intelligent people, journalism and trips to the island of Greenland interesting, we'll see you there!

The institute has passed a new rule restricting bicycles to the newly constructed lanes during class hours. But it has come to the notice of TSA that the cramped lanes often lead to accidents while the roads tend to remain empty for most of the time. Many students also expressed the feeling that the rule curbs their freedom at KGP.

What do KGPians think about this rule and what has been your experience so far?

Tomorrow, at 6:30 PM, the greatest secrets of the universe would be revealed, including what The Scholars' Avenue is all about. Moreover, we'll flabbergast you with some of our amazing analyses on KGP. If you find writing, hanging out with cool and intelligent people, journalism and trips to the island of Greenland interesting, we'll see you there!

Independence Day Schedule

Venue : Bidhan Chowk

08:56 am - Arrival of the Director
08:58 am - General Salute by IIT Security & NCC Cadets.
09:00 am - Unfurling of National Flag by Director followed by National Anthem.
09:03 am - Director Inspects the Guard of Honour
09:07 am - Oath Taking Ceremony
09:10 am - Address by the Director
There are other programs as well. You can check it on this poster.

Awaaz, IIT Kharagpur wishes everyone Happy Independence Day.

The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's post. We welcome Prof B N Singh as the new Dean of HR, IIT Kharagpur. He will look after all matters related to employees other than Faculty. We also welcome Prof Pallab Dasgupta as Dean Sponsored Research & Industrial Consultancy (SRIC) and Prof Suman Chakraborty as the new Associate Dean of SRIC. All of them have take up their roles today. We deeply acknowledge the contributions of Prof Sunando Dasgupta, the outgoing Dean SRIC.

message:
Congratulations to Team KART-Formula SAE team of IIT-Kharagpur on the successful unveiling of their latest car - the K3. We hope all their great efforts and pains in making the car are repaid in renewed heaps of prestige - both to the team and our institute at an international level. 

We had a chance to talk to the heads of the team, who were more than happy to explain about their car. You can read it here:
http://www.scholarsavenue.org/campus-2/the-russian-calling-for-teamkart/

The teaser of the unveiling of the car and the making of the car have  been covered extensively by our own Technology Filmmaking & Photography Society, IIT Kharagpur - TFPS . The links to the videos are given below:

Teaser : https://youtu.be/Te-liFOwac0

Behind the Scenes : https://youtu.be/y1-rj-D_hgE

The Scholars' Avenue wishes the team all the very best for their future ventures.

The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo. Congratulations to Prof Manoj Tiwari from Depatment of ISE, Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur for being awarded “The Most Influential Researcher” in the area of Operations Management in India on the occasion of the 3rd International Conference on Green Supply Chain Management, which was organized at Loughborough University, London from 10th -13th July 2016. Prof. Tiwari received this award from Prof. Sir Mike Gregory. Prof. Sir Mike Gregory is one of the most influential academics in the UK and the Co-Founder and Head of the Institute of Manufacturing and Management Division at Cambridge University, UK. The award was given to Prof. Tiwari for his pioneering contribution to the field of Operations and Supply Chain Management and was based on his credentials, citations and research by leading international researchers, who suggested that Prof. Tiwari is the most influential researcher in India in this field of research in their findings
story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo.

message: The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo. IIT Kharagpur announces Distinguished Alumnus Awards 2016 IIT Kharagpur to award 7 of its Distinguished Alumni for significant contributions to the professional world and society Kharagpur, July 12, 2016: Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur will confer the Distinguished Alumnus Award on the occasion of the 62nd Convocation of the Institute being organized on July 30 and 31, 2016. Seven eminent alumni have been selected for the award for their exceptional professional achievements in the industry, in the academia or as entrepreneur. The awardees, in alphabetical order, are - Dr. Anurag Acharya (IIT KGP B.Tech./Computer Science and Engineering/1987), Distinguished Engineer at Google USA. Dr. Acharya is key founder of Google Scholar which since its inception has become an indispensable service for the global academic and research community. Shri Ajit Jain (IIT KGP B.Tech./Mechanical Engineering/1972), President of Reinsurance Division, Berkshire Hathaway Insurance Group, USA. Shri Jain is a visionary in the global investment sector, having led Berkshire Hathaway to great heights. He is a well-known philanthropist as well funding the Jain Foundation with the mission is to cure muscular dystrophies. Dr. Asoke Deysarkar (IIT KGP B.Tech./Chemical Engineering/1971), CEO & Chairman, PfP Industries, USA. Dr. Deysarkar has blended his research with entrepreneurship in Chemical Engineering forming a billion dollar conglomerate of companies. The Deysarkar Family has helped establish the Trans-disciplinary Program in Petroleum Engineering at IIT KGP. Dr. Deysarkar is also known for his philanthropy activities. Prof. Gautam Biswas (IIT KGP Ph.D/Mechanical Engineering / 1985), Director, Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati. Prof. Biswas has an illustrious academic career of 25 years having taught at IIT Kharagpur, IIT Kanpur and in various international universities and known for his leadership at IIT Kanpur, Central Mechanical Engineering Research Institute, Durgapur and IIT Guwahati. His fundamental research on heat transfer phenomena is well recognised in the international academic community. He was the Founder Director of Academy of Scientific and Innovative Research (AcSIR), New Delhi. Prof. Indranil Manna (IIT KGP Ph.D/Metallurgical and Materials Engineering/ 1990), Director, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur. He has been an exceptional academician and researcher having a long-standing association with IIT Kharagpur as faculty and thereafter leading the Central Glass and Ceramic Research Institute, Kolkata and IIT Kanpur. His significant contributions in advanced material science and engineering have been well recognised by national and international bodies. Prof. Supriyo Bandopadhyay (IIT KGP B.Tech./Electronics and Electrical Communications Engineering/1980), Commonwealth Professor, Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, Virginia Commonwealth University, USA. Recently he was named Virginia's Outstanding Scientist and is known globally for his interdisciplinary research. He directs the Quantum Device Laboratory in the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering which has been frequently featured in national and international media for exemplary research in nanotechnology. Venkatesan Thirumalai (B.Sc./Physics /1969), Director, NUSNNI-NanoCore, National University of Singapore. He is known for his pioneering research in laser technology. Prof. Venkatesan was Founder of the PhD/MBA program in NUS and the Surface Center at Rutgers University. The Distinguished Alumnus Award is one of the highest recognitions given of accomplishment and contribution of an alumnus/alumna from the Institute. The awardees will be given a gold medal and a certificate.
story: The Scholars' Avenue shared Director IIT Kharagpur's photo.

message: Technology, IIT Kharagpur shared Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur's post. SRISTI celebrates the creativity and innovation of young technological students by recognising their outstanding projects with Gandhian Young Technological Innovation (GYTI) Awards. These awards are given every year during the Festival of Innovation (FOIN) at Rashtrapati Bhawan in the month of March. Next year, these awards are due tentatively on March 5, 2017 at FOIN. It is hoped that such recognition will enthuse young innovators to pursue even more outstanding research addressing unmet social needs and set up entrepreneurial ventures in consonance with Start-Up movement gaining strength currently in India. Any student project that has been completed during 2014-15 to 2016-17 is eligible for consideration of awards.The students need to submit the projects at following URL: www.gyti.techpe Financial support is also given to some of the awardees as per numerous windows of opportunity: Last date for submission of entries is November 30, 2016 You can email your queries to gyti.techpedia@ ,or call at 9099258492.

story: Technology, IIT Kharagpur added 6 new photos — with Vedasheersh Boorla and Somesh Kumar.

message:
A senior astrophysicist at NASA, Prof. Mather is the recipient of 2006 Nobel prize in Physics. He is a senior project scientist at JSWT, which will be successor to Hubble Space Telescope. He was part of the COBE satellite, which confirmed the Big Bang theory. He was listed twice by TIME magazine; among 100 most influential people in the world in 2007 and then again in 2012 among 25 most influential people in space.

Strengthen the foundation of your thoughts through his precious words.

Date: 29th February (Monday), 6:30 PM
Venue: CET Studio 1, First Floor, Takshashila

A PAN IIT interactive session with Prof. Herald Haas has been arranged on 14th February at 6:30PM. Prof. Haas holds the Chair of Mobile Communications at the University of Edinburgh. He is acclaimed to be the inventor of Light Fidelity (Li-Fi) which was listed among the 50 best inventions in TIME Magazine 2011.

Link for webcast is http://nknvcreplay.nic.in/replay/webcastShow.html?key=vUUIZ1dDHHitrBr

Link will be live from Sunday (14th Feb.) 6:30 PM onward. Venue for online interaction is NKN Virtual Classroom, JCB Lab Complex.

Note: The event will consist of a keynote speech from 6:30 PM - 8:00 PM. Q&A session will be from 8:15 PM.

IIT Kharagpur has won the 4th Inter IIT Tech General Championship winning the General Championship for a continuous 2nd time in a row.

Results of all Events:

Social Media Analysis:
1st. IIT Kharagpur
2nd. IIT Mandi
3rd. IIT Madras

Internet of Things:
1st. IIT Madras
2nd. IIT Kanpur and IIT Kharagpur
3rd. IIT Patna

Tech Quiz:
1st. IIT Ropar
2nd. IIT Kanpur
3rd. IIT Bhubaneshwar

Embedded Systems:
1st. IIT Kharagpur
2nd. IIT Kanpur
3rd. IIT Mandi

Software Development:
1st. IIT Kharagpur
2nd. IIT Kanpur
3rd. IIT Mandi

Product Exhibition:
1st. IIT Kharagpur
2nd. IIT Kharagpur
3rd. IIT Madras

Portfolio Defender:
1st. IIT Kharagpur
2nd. IIT Mandi
3rd. IIT Madras

Hardware Modelling
1st. IIT Kharagpur
2nd. IIT Kanpur
3rd. IIT Roorkee.

Congratulations to all the winners!!

Inter IIT Product design exhibition
Top 2 teams will get a chance to represent IIT Kharagpur in 4th Inter IIT Tech Meet.

The most awaited  teams list of IIT Kharagpur for the 4th Inter IIT Tech meet to be held in IIT Mandi.

Congratulations to all the selected students!
